required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Recombinant Lactoferrin to Reduce Immune Activation and Coagulation Among HIV Positive Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Our general goal is to evaluate the potential effectiveness of recombinant lactoferrin (1500mg bid) for reducing inflammation among HIV positive participants.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With at Least One Side Effect, Adverse Event, and Serious Adverse Event
primary_outcome.time_frame: During 3 months on Lactoferrin or Placebo (and following washout period)
primary_outcome.description: Self reported side effects and/or Division of AIDS (DAIDS) criteria will be used for grading adverse events (serious and non-serious)

primary_outcome.measure: IL-6 & D-dimer Score Changes From Baseline to 3 Months (or Month 5 to Month 8)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months (Baseline to Month 3 or Month 5 to Month 8)
primary_outcome.description: The IL-6 & D-dimer score is defined as: 0. 33*log2 IL-6 + 0.16*log2 D-dimer, where IL-6 is measured in pg/mL and D-dimer in ug/mL. Since the biomarkers are on the log2 scale, associations of risk with the IL-6 & D-dimer score are interpreted as "HR(event) per doubling of IL-6 and D-dimer", or "HR(event) per 20% increase in IL-6 and D-dimer"; the score itself is unitless. Among the 3766 study participants for whom the score was developed, the min was -1.7, the max was 2.5. Higher scores are worse.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Taking Medication as Assigned
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants taking medication as assigned at 3 months

other_outcome.description: The change in CD16+ monocyte subsets will be compared between active and placebo treatment phases. During both the active and placebo treatment phase, all relevant time points are used in calculation of change (i.e., baseline, month 1 and month 3 for phase 1; and similarly months 5, 6 and 8 for phase 2).

The change in blood levels of sCD163 will be compared between active and placebo treatment phases. During both the active and placebo treatment phase, all relevant time points are used in calculation of change (i.e., baseline, month 1 and month 3 for phase 1; and similarly months 5, 6 and 8 for phase 2).

arm_group.description: Recombinant lactoferrin will be administered by mouth twice daily
Matched placebo will be administered by mouth twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. HIV-positive participants receiving Antiretroviral Therapy (ART) for >1 year
2. HIV RNA level <200 copies/mL for at least 6 months (â‰¥2 separate values)
3. Age >40 years
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior cardiovascular disease or stroke
2. Diabetes
3. Rheumatologic Diseases
4. Pregnancy
5. Chronic kidney disease, stage IV or V (creatinine clearance <30 mL/min/1.73m2)
6. Cirrhosis or end-stage liver disease

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: One participant was administratively withdrawn prior to receiving medication.

group.title: Placebo First Then Lactoferrin
group.description: Participants receive placebo during first period, then Lactoferrin in second period after washout.

group.title: Lactoferrin First Then Placebo
group.description: Participants receive Lactoferrin during first period, then placebo in second period after washout.

group.title: Entire Study Population
group.description: Includes groups randomized to receive placebo first and active drug first.

measure.title: Diastolic Blood Pressure
measure.population: All 54 participants started the first period, not all participants started the second period. Across both periods of treatment a total of 51 participants started Lactoferrin treatment and 49 participants started placebo treatment.

measure.title: Systolic Blood Pressure
measure.population: All 54 participants started the first period, not all participants started the second period. Across both periods of treatment a total of 51 participants started Lactoferrin treatment and 49 participants started placebo treatment.

measure.title: Interleukin-6 and D-Dimer Score
measure.description: The IL-6 & D-dimer score is defined as: 0. 33*log2 IL-6 + 0.16*log2 D-dimer, where IL-6 is measured in pg/mL and D-dimer in ug/mL. Since the biomarkers are on the log2 scale, associations of risk with the IL-6 & D-dimer score are interpreted as "Hazard Ratio (HR)(event) per doubling of IL-6 and D-dimer", or "HR(event) per 20% increase in IL-6 and D-dimer"; the score itself is unitless. Among the 3766 study participants for whom the score was developed, the min was -1.7, the max was 2.5. Higher scores are worse.
measure.population: All 54 participants started the first period, not all participants started the second period. Across both periods of treatment a total of 51 participants started Lactoferrin treatment and 49 participants started placebo treatment.

measure.title: Small Artery Elasticity
measure.population: All 54 participants started the first period, not all participants started the second period. Across both periods of treatment a total of 51 participants started Lactoferrin treatment and 49 participants started placebo treatment.

measure.title: Large Artery Elasticity
measure.population: All 54 participants started the first period, not all participants started the second period. Across both periods of treatment a total of 51 participants started Lactoferrin treatment and 49 participants started placebo treatment.

measure.title: Monocyte CD16+
measure.population: All 54 participants started the first period, not all participants started the second period. Across both periods of treatment a total of 51 participants started Lactoferrin treatment and 49 participants started placebo treatment.

measure.title: sCD163
measure.population: All 54 participants started the first period, not all participants started the second period. Across both periods of treatment a total of 51 participants started Lactoferrin treatment and 49 participants started placebo treatment.

class.title: At least one adverse event (includes SAE)
At least one Serious Adverse Event

outcome.title: IL-6 & D-dimer Score Changes From Baseline to 3 Months (or Month 5 to Month 8)
outcome.description: The IL-6 & D-dimer score is defined as: 0. 33*log2 IL-6 + 0.16*log2 D-dimer, where IL-6 is measured in pg/mL and D-dimer in ug/mL. Since the biomarkers are on the log2 scale, associations of risk with the IL-6 & D-dimer score are interpreted as "HR(event) per doubling of IL-6 and D-dimer", or "HR(event) per 20% increase in IL-6 and D-dimer"; the score itself is unitless. Among the 3766 study participants for whom the score was developed, the min was -1.7, the max was 2.5. Higher scores are worse.
outcome.time_frame: 3 months (Baseline to Month 3 or Month 5 to Month 8)
outcome.population: 45 participants contributed data during phase two. Participants had to attend the first visit (baseline or month 5) and also one follow-up visit in order to contribute data to the analyses.

outcome.title: Activated Monocyte Phenotype (CD16+)
outcome.description: The change in CD16+ monocyte subsets will be compared between active and placebo treatment phases. During both the active and placebo treatment phase, all relevant time points are used in calculation of change (i.e., baseline, month 1 and month 3 for phase 1; and similarly months 5, 6 and 8 for phase 2).
outcome.population: 45 participants contributed data during phase two. Participants had to attend the first visit (baseline or month 5) and also one follow-up visit in order to contribute data to the analyses. Fewer participants had pre-drug and post-drug cells collected so numbers are less than 45 for this measure.

event.sub_title: hospitalization for confusion, disorientation, shakiness, unsteady gait and vomiting

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
